explanation: Agent A is correct. MHD_add_response_footer simply forwards its header/content pointers to add_response_entry which calls strlen(header) and strlen(content) without any NULL or termination checks, then passes the resulting lengths to add_response_entry_n which uses memchr(header, ..., header_len). If a caller supplies a header (or content) that is not a valid NUL-terminated object (or supplies a buffer shorter than the bytes scanned by strlen), strlen will already read beyond the object and produce an incorrect header_len; memchr(header, ..., header_len) will then attempt to access header_len bytes and thus can access beyond the bounds of the object. That usage of strlen/memchr can therefore result in out-of-bounds accesses and violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 unless the API formally guarantees (and documents/ensures) that the pointers refer to NUL-terminated, sufficiently large objects. No such guarantee/check is visible in the provided code, so the reported violation is valid.
